SamplingSummaryMsg: The summary of your last sampling is now available !
MacroTutorialDescription1: Find a site accessible on foot (between 30 meters and 100 meters)
MacroTutorialStep2: Fine the wreck line on the beach/riverbank
MacroTutorialDescription2: Select the most polluted area of the site.
MacroTutorialDescription3: Take a photo of the sampling site (the wreck line and the pollution).
MacroTutorialDescription4: Unwind the rope or tape measure between 30 meters and (ideally) 100 meters.
MacroTutorialDescription5:
Record the waste collected in the app.

Place the waste in trash bags after recording it.
MacroTutorialDescription6:
Use the scale to measure the total weight of the waste.

Also estimate its volume.
MacroTutorialDescription7: Dispose of the waste in the appropriate containers.
MicroTutorialDescription1:
Add 50x50 centimeters quadrats evenly along your rope.

Three if length < 75 meters, four if length > 75 meters.
MicroTutorialDescription2: Use the tweezers to sort meso/microplastics from other waste.
MicroTutorialDescription3:
Place the mesoplastics and microplastics in two separate jars after measuring them.

You do NOT have to weigh them.
DistanceSelectionViewTitleText: The distance should be between 30 meters to 100 meters.
PostSamplingViewImagePickerMsg: You've refused to allow this app to access your camera!
PostSamplingViewAddImageMsg: Adding an image helps researchers improve their research!
PostSamplingViewAddWeightMsg: By providing weight data, scientists are able to better understand if the macroplastics are being heavily fragmented relative to their weight.
CelebrationViewThankYou: Thank you for your contribution to FLOW's cause
FlowDescription: FLOW, an acronym for 'For Living Oceans and Water', is a project serving and in favor of living water and oceans. It is part of a sustainable approach to ecosystems and their protection.
MissionDescription: Flow's mission is to use participatory science and environmental education to support the general public and conservation stakeholders through actions contributing to the fight against pollution caused by plastic waste.
LocalisationDescription: Authorize the application to access your location
ExitPopUpWarning: Are you sure you want to stop sampling ?
ExitPopUpMsg: All the data from this sample will be lost.
MaterialsModalTitle: Do you have the right equipment to start a sampling ?
MaterialsModalText: During a sampling, it is important to have the necessary equipment in order to ensure your safety as well as the smooth running of the sampling.
ClothingDescription: Wear thick shoes or boots, cut-resistant gloves and a safety vest.
RopeDescription: Bring something to mark out the space. A rope at least 30 meters long, up to 100 meters and coloured studs.
RulerDescription: To check the size of the collected macro-waste (> 2.5cm).
ScaleDescription: Determine the total mass of the waste using a scale.
WaterBucketDescription: Clean water collected on the site.
TrowelDescription: Also bring a stainless steel fine sieve and a stainless steel spoon.
JarDescription: One jar for storing macroplastics and one jar for storing meso/microplastics.
TweezersDescription: To sort and divide collected plastic waste into two size categories.
EndMessageQuiz: Go to the interactive guide to learn more
SummaryTitle: Here is the report of your last collection!
AvgTitle: Here is the average of your samplings !
TotalTitle: Hedre is the total of your samplings !
value025: Please enter a value between 0 and 25
NoStatsSubTitle: Come back after taking a sample.
StackedChartTitle: Evolution of the collected types of plastic
